description:
Convert UI to Match *arr Project Standards (Sonarr/Radarr Style)

Redesign the application UI to follow the established design patterns and conventions used by Sonarr, Radarr, Lidarr, and other *arr project family members.

Technical Implementation:
- UI Framework: React with TypeScript, styled-components or CSS modules
- Layout: Sidebar navigation with collapsible sections, top search bar, settings icon
- Theme System: Dark/light theme toggle with *arr-style color palette
  - Dark: #1f1f1f background, #282828 cards, #007bff accent
  - Light: #f5f5f5 background, #ffffff cards, #007bff accent
- Component Library: Match *arr design system components

Core Components to Implement:
- SidebarNav (dashboard, library, calendar, activity, settings)
- PageHeader (breadcrumbs, actions, search)
- TableView (sortable columns, inline actions, mass selection)
- CardGrid (poster view with hover actions)
- ModalDialog (*arr-style modals with consistent styling)
- Toast Notifications (top-right position, auto-dismiss)
- LoadingSpinner (*arr animated loader)

Key Pages to Redesign:
- Dashboard (activity cards, upcoming items, system status)
- Library View (table/card toggle, bulk operations, filtering)
- Calendar View (weekly/monthly views with color coding)
- Activity/Queue (progress bars, status indicators)
- Settings (tabbed navigation, save/test buttons)

State Management:
- Use Redux or Zustand for global state
- Persist theme preference and view settings to localStorage

API Integration:
- RESTful endpoints matching *arr conventions
- Polling for activity updates (5-second intervals)
- WebSocket support for real-time queue updates

Performance:
- Virtual scrolling for large libraries (react-window)
- Image lazy loading with placeholder cards
- Debounced search (300ms)

Responsive Design:
- Mobile-first approach with hamburger menu
- Breakpoints: mobile (<768px), tablet (768-1024px), desktop (>1024px)

Icons & Assets:
- Use Font Awesome or similar icon library matching *arr projects
- Consistent icon usage across actions (download, edit, delete, refresh)
